result.execSummary:
Charge(s) in this case were read in to this or other case(s). A "read in" charge is a charge that is dismissed as part of a plea agreement, however:

  • The defendant agrees to have the court consider the charge(s) when sentencing for another crime, under Wis. Stats. 973.20(1g)(b); and
  • The defendant cannot be prosecuted for these charge(s) in the future.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.
result.caption: State of Wisconsin vs. Joseph R Nienow

Case Called: 8:35am

State appears by ADA Sidney Brubacher; Deft appears in person with Atty Peter Rotter
Date and time was set for court trial

State says parties have come to stipulation and are ready to proceed with plea today in 15TR3160
Plea Quest/Waiver of Rights filed.  VRCW.
State moves to:
15TR3161:
Ct. 1 Deviation from designated lane >> Dismissed
15TR3146:
Ct. 1 Refuse to take test for intoxication after arrest >> NOT vacated
15TR3162:
Ct. 1 Operating while suspended >> Dismissed
15CM1280:
Ct. 1 Resisting or obstructing an officer >> D&RI
Ct. 2 Possession of Cocaine >> D&RI
16TR2871:
Ct. 1 Display false vehicle registration plate >> Dismissed
16CM1443:
Ct.1 Operating while revoked >> D&RI
Ct. 2 Ignition interlock device tampering/failure to install >> D&RI
Ct. 3 Bail Jumping- Misdemeanor >> D&RI
COURT grants above
PLEA: 
15TR3160:
Ct. 1 OWI (1st) >> NO CONTEST 

COURT advises def of rights (including constitutional rights) & penalties & ques def to understanding.  
COURT finds plea & waiver of rights freely & vol made,  factual basis, & def guilty. 
COURT ORDERS: Pay $814.00 forfeiture inclusive of all costs. CONDITIONS: 6 months driver license revocation, administrative credit granted for time already served. 6 points against driving record. Complete AODA assessment with follow through, deft does not need to duplicate if already completed AODA assessment.

Date and time set for oral ruling on refusal to take test for intoxication after arrest

COURT finds deft refusal to be unlawful
State asks court to enter judgment on this refusal
COURT ORDERS: enters judgment on refusal and orders deft 12 months driver's license revocation, 12 months IID to be installed immediately. Complete AODA assessment with follow through.
